t: Proverbs 24
Be*pn not envious of evil men, nor*ld desire to be with them,
for*ln their hearts devise violence, and*ld their lips talk of trouble.
By*pn wisdom a house is built, and*ld by understanding it is established;
by*ln knowledge the rooms are filled with*ld all precious and pleasant riches.
A*ln wise man is full of strength, and*ld a man of knowledge enhances his might,
for*ln by wise guidance you can wage your war, and*ld in abundance of counselors there is victory.
Wisdom*ln is too high for a fool; in*ld the gate he does not open his mouth.
Whoever*pn plans to do evil will*ld be called a schemer.
The*ln devising of folly is sin, and*ld the scoffer is an abomination to mankind.
If*pn you faint in the day of adversity, your*ld strength is small.
Rescue*ln those who are being taken away to death; hold*ld back those who are stumbling to the slaughter.

If*ln you say, “Behold, we did not know this,” does*ld not he who weighs the heart perceive it? Does*ln not he who keeps watch over your soul know it, and*ld will he not repay man according to his work?
My*pn son, eat honey, for it is good, and*ld the drippings of the honeycomb are sweet to your taste.
Know*ln that wisdom is such to your soul; if*ld you find it, there will be a future, and*ld your hope will not be cut off.
Lie*pn not in wait as a wicked man against the dwelling of the righteous; do*ld no violence to his home;
for*ln the righteous falls seven times and rises again, but*ld the wicked stumble in times of calamity.
Do*pn not rejoice when your enemy falls, and*ld let not your heart be glad when he stumbles,
lest*ln the Lord*s see it and be displeased, and*ld turn away his anger from him.
Fret*pn not yourself because of evildoers, and*ld be not envious of the wicked,
for*ln the evil man has no future; the*ld lamp of the wicked will be put out.
My*pn son, fear the Lord*s and the king, and*ld do not join with those who do otherwise,
for*ln disaster will arise suddenly from them, and*ld who knows the ruin that will come from them both?
More Sayings of the Wise
These*p also are sayings of the wise. Partiality*pn in judging is not good.
Whoever*ln says to the wicked, “You are in the right,” will*ld be cursed by peoples, abhorred by nations,
but*ln those who rebuke the wicked will have delight, and*ld a good blessing will come upon them.
Whoever*ln gives an honest answer kisses*ld the lips.
Prepare*pn your work outside; get*ld everything ready for yourself in the field, and*ld after that build your house.
Be*pn not a witness against your neighbor without cause, and*ld do not deceive with your lips.
Do*ln not say, “I will do to him as he has done to me; I*ld will pay the man back for what he has done.”
I*pn passed by the field of a sluggard, by*ld the vineyard of a man lacking sense,
and*ln behold, it was all overgrown with thorns; the*ld ground was covered with nettles, and*ld its stone wall was broken down.
Then*ln I saw and considered it; I*ld looked and received instruction.
A*ln little sleep, a little slumber, a*ld little folding of the hands to rest,
and*ln poverty will come upon you like a robber, and*ld want like an armed man.
